# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `h_cpd`
* Variable label: `History of chronic pulmonary disorders`
* Variable description: `history of chronic pulmonary disease`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | NO chronic pulmonary disease
1        | chronic pulmonary disease

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing


<!-- ########################################################## --> 
<!-- # Global variables -->
```{r global, include=FALSE, echo=F}
miss_values_vector <- c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999)
ds_label <- "History of chronic pulmonary disorders"
cat_label <- c("No" = 0, "Yes" = 1, "Missing" = 999, "Do not know" = 998, "Refuse" = 997, "Not applicable" = 996, "Does not answer" = 995, "Not attempt not done" = 994, "Disable to measure" = 993, "Impute" = 992, "CAPI interviewer error" = 991)
cont_label <- cat_label[3:11]
datafolder <- "../RData/"
#sing_idlist <- c()
```

# Data process




## South Africa


### Wave 1


#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `q4025` |
|-|-|
| **Label** | `q4025: chronic lung disease`|
| **Table name**  | `southAfricaINDdata`| 
| **Categories** | `1 = yes`<br/>`2 = no` |
| **Missings** | `NA`<br/>`8 = don't know` |
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign SA_w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'SAGE_SA_w1','SAGE.southAfricaINDdata',variables=list('q4025'), missings = T)
SAGE_SA_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'SAGE_SA_w1')

```

```{r local SA_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- SAGE_SA_w1$q4025
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = c(8))[3], caption = names(SAGE_SA_w1)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = c(8))[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(SAGE_SA_w1, aes(x=factor(q4025))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_cpd` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `2 into 0`
* `1 into 1`
* `8 into 998`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo SA_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
SAGE_ds_SA_w1 <- tibble(id=SAGE_SA_w1$id)
SAGE_ds_SA_w1$h_cpd <- car::recode(SAGE_SA_w1$q4025,"2=0;8=998;NA=999")

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript SA_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- SAGE_ds_SA_w1$h_cpd
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(SAGE_ds_SA_w1, aes(x=factor(h_cpd))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation SA_w1, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(SAGE_ds_SA_w1$h_cpd)
BeforeH <- table(SAGE_SA_w1$q4025,useNA = "ifany")[c(2,1,3,4)]
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("2->0","1->1","8->998","NA->999")
kable(C)

```

## Descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable:


**R script:**

```{r summ}

l.hds <- list(SA_w1 = SAGE_ds_SA_w1 , ghana_w1 = SAGE_ds_ghana_w1, china_w1 = SAGE_ds_china_w1, india_w1=SAGE_ds_india_w1, russia_w1=SAGE_ds_russia_w1, mexico_w1=SAGE_ds_mexico_w1)

for(name in names(l.hds)) {
  m_name <- paste0("SAGE_m_ds_",name)
  aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
  label(l.hds[[name]][[2]]) <- label(aux_object[[2]]) <- ds_label # Text value assigned at the DS description, at the top
  aux_object[[2]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[2]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
  l.hds[[name]][[2]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[2]], labels = cat_label)
  aux_object[[2]] <- labelled(aux_object[[2]], labels = cat_label[1:2])
  assign(m_name, aux_object)
  rm(aux_object)
}

t.hds <- frq(l.hds[[1]][2])[[1]][,c(1,2)] 
for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
  t.hds[2+i] <- frq(l.hds[[i]][2])[[1]][,4] 
}
t.hds[13,] <- c("n", "sample size", 
             length(l.hds[[1]][[2]]), length(l.hds[[2]][[2]]) , length(l.hds[[3]][[2]]), length(l.hds[[4]][[2]]), length(l.hds[[5]][[2]]), length(l.hds[[6]][[2]]) )
names(t.hds)<-c("val", "label", "South_Africa_w1", "Ghana_W1", "China_W1", "India_W1", "Russia_W1", "Mexico_W1")
kable(t.hds)

```
